result.execSummary:
The defendant Martell Ringo Lay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: If the defendant is revoked, the defendant will serve 18 months straight time, with 5 days credit.  No Huber release.

miscConds.notes:
Complete Parenting classes  and course in anger management.
Complete individual therapy and, if recommended, family therapy.

Provide DNA sample. 
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martell Ringo Lay

records.addlTxt: CORRECTION TO 9/9/2022 ENTRY, CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.

Defendant Martell Ringo Lay in court.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Martell Ringo Lay.  Attorney Jessica Ann Behling in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Plea and Sentencing hearing.  Amended Information filed. Charges amended to Misdemeanor Battery. Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1 : Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNT 2 : : Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, body armor, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. Monica B. and Danielle B. make statements to the court, via zoom.

AS TO COUNT 1 : Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive with Count 2, with credit for 5 days served. 
Court STAYED the sentence(s) and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 2 : Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive with Count 1. 
Court STAYED the sentence(s) and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- no corporal punishment
- Complete Parenting classes  and course in anger management.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Complete individual therapy and, if recommended, family therapy.
- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
- provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered

If the defendant is revoked, the defendant will serve 18 months straight time, with 5 days credit.  No Huber release.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Certificates of Completion, filed.
/filed.
filed.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Martell Ringo Lay in court with Attorney Katherine Graber. Defendant appeared by zoom.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim's mother is requesting to modify no contact order.  Court denied request to modify mo contact order. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case is adjourned to 9-9-22 at 2:30 pm for plea and sentencing in person in Room 504 of the courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
Court will reduce JusticePoint supervision level from Level 5 to Level 4.

Defendant Martell Ringo Lay in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Martell Ringo Lay appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Court addressed bail conditions and no contact order.  Court will allow defendant to attend son's graduation, but not to have any contact with the parties listed on the no contact order.  Court denies any additional modification to the no contact order.  Additionally, Court will reduce JusticePoint supervision level from Level 5 to Level 4.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Martell Ringo Lay in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for on defense motion to modify no contact order to a no violent contact order.  State objects. Court denied defense request to modify no contact order but will allow third party contact with adults for financial reasons only. 
Case is adjourned to 5-27-22 at 8:30 am for status conference, by zoom.
  This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Statement about NCO, filed.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
22RM021148  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff 04/13/2022

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 10:
Defendant Martell Ringo Lay in court with Attorney Katherine Graber.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 10, Judge Havas. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense requests to address the no contact order on the next date. Case is adjourned to Br. 10.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. statement about NCO from Monica B
Received and Filed. Statement about NCO from def mom
received and filed.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with DBC, DEB, or DB
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Martell Ringo Lay in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Martell Ringo Lay in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Martell Ringo Lay appeared by video means with Attorney.  Due to assignment of Assistant District Attorney, the defendant is advised that case is reassigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Case is adjourned to Br. PE for Branch 10.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
